publicwhip.spmotion: S1M-2112 Higher Still and the SQA (lodged on 15 August 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Irene McGugan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-2112 Michael Russell: Higher Still and the SQA—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive (a) to bring forward clear and firm proposals at the start of the coming Parliamentary sitting period which will commence the process of simplification of Higher Still examinations with the aim of making significant changes in the coming school year and completing the process in the subsequent year, (b) to continue with the review process of Higher Still and include in this consideration of the nature, intensity and level of assessment demanded, on a national basis, of Scotland’s young people and (c) to make early proposals to the Parliament for the creation of an appropriate, effective and accountable body to organise, supervise and moderate Scotland’s national school and college examination system. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-2112 Higher Still and the SQA (lodged on 15 August 2001) Shona Robison*
S1M-2112 Higher Still and the SQA (lodged on 15 August 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-2112 Higher Still and the SQA (lodged on 15 August 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Alasdair Morgan*

Supported by: Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Shona Robison, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alasdair Morgan, Donald Gorrie*
